law.catch_line: There is a Joint Committee on Workers' Compensation Benefit and Insurance Oversight....

text.section: There is a Joint Committee on Workers' Compensation Benefit and Insurance Oversight.
The members of the Committee serve at the pleasure of the presiding officer who appointed them.
The President and the Speaker shall jointly appoint a Senator and a Delegate each to serve as cochair.

section.section:
The Committee shall examine and evaluate:
the condition of the workers' compensation benefit and insurance structure in the State; and
the effect of Chapters 590 and 591 of the Laws of Maryland of 1987 on that structure.
This examination shall include the regulations adopted by the Workers' Compensation Commission that are to be used by physicians to measure impairment when preparing medical evaluations of claimants.

text.section:
The Insurance Commissioner and the Workers' Compensation Commission shall:
cooperate fully with the Committee;
keep the Committee fully informed as to the condition of workers' compensation benefits and workers' compensation insurance in the State and the effect of Chapters 590 and 591 of the Laws of Maryland of 1987 on those benefits and that insurance; and
submit an annual report, subject to § 2-1246 of this title, to the Committee on or before October 1 of each year that incorporates the information described in item (2) of this subsection.
The Committee shall report to the Governor and the Legislative Policy Committee on December 31 of each year.
